snippet: Syria’s political opposition accused President Bashar al-Assad of escalating military assaults on four major urban centers on Tuesday.
abstract: Syria’s political opposition accuses Pres Bashar al-Assad of escalating military assaults on four major urban centers; such assaults directly contradict the Syrian government’s promise that it would immediately begin pulling armed forces back from population centers, in accordance with a special envoy’s cease-fire plan.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Syria’s political opposition accused President Bashar al-Assad of escalating military assaults on four major urban centers on Tuesday.
